text: Use our clickable sections below
to keep track of what step you're on
during this tutorial.
Create a Bumble account and open the app.

Follow the prompts and
set up your profile.

This includes a bio,
photos, and move makers,

which are questions for you
to show off your personality.

Now you'll have to choose what
kind of mode you want to use.
We're going to start with date mode,
though each mode is structured similarly.
You'll see people to swipe through here.
Your account information is here,

and your conversations with
your matches will live here.

When swiping, scroll up to
see more of their profile.
Swipe left if you're not interested,
and swipe right if you are.
You'll be alerted when you match.
For opposite-gender matches on Bumble,
only women can initiate the conversation.
If you're matching with the same gender,

you both have the option
of messaging first.
Each match expires in 24 hours.
You can also create a friendship profile
and career-networking profile on Bumble.
To do this, go to the profile tab

and click the cog-wheel
icon on the top right,
which brings you to settings.

There, you can choose
the mode to switch to.
You can keep your date-mode profile active
by toggling it on
or hiding it by toggling it off.

If you're looking for a
friend, choose bff mode.
It's a similar setup,

but you'll only see
users of the same gender.

Once you match, either
person can message first.

Bumble bizz is focused
on career networking.

You can build your profile
as an almost casual résumé.

You include your skills and
more about yourself here

and list your previous jobs
and education right under.
In Bumble bizz,

only women can message first
in an opposite-gender match.
In any same-gender pairing,

the second person to swipe
right can message first.

In every mode, your matches
expire after 24 hours
with the free version of Bumble,
but you can buy paid features.
Happy swiping!
